title: Trion (producer of Rift and other titles) got bought out yesterday
body:
After years of management bungles and a solid year of no new content for Rift, Trion just got bought out (acquisition of debt, not a sale, technically) by Gamigo, a German company that basically operates a graveyard of once-not-so-popular games. 90% of the staff was laid off without notice and gone in a day. From this point, the most we can expect is the occasional cosmetic item added to the cash shop. Other than that, it's maintenance mode for a few years until it's not worth the effort of restarting the server every couple weeks, and then it goes the way of Wildstar (which is shutting down on November 28).

If you want to see posts from people who saw the writing on the wall as well as those who still believe that a new infusion of cash and development effort is right around the corner: http://forums.riftgame.com/general-discussions/news-announcements/507138-trion-transitioning-question-comment-thread.html
